Articles.Content:
Just an idea I had while flipping through the forums. What if at certain points during flight (gravity turn, certain altitudes/velocities?) the kerbals would commence some radio chatter back and forth with mission control that could be heard by the player, but was pretty much just some indistinguishable cute little kerbal language with radio static and noises akin to real rocket and shuttle launches.

Not all that important to gameplay or anything but maybe it could increase immersion, anyways just a thought I had.

Firstly, the obligatory, "yes, it would be good if this were made stock".

Secondly, before anyone else gets in: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92324-0-24-2-Chatterer-v-0-6-0-Aug-29-2014

Oh, didn't realize that. I thought that was a chat program for actual people playing ksp at the same time.

Okay, well sorry for the unnecessary thread.
Yes something like chatterer would be nice to add to the ambiance in stock. If fact, Chatterer is 1 of only 2 r4pt0r approved mods, along with enviormentalvisualenhancements.

Yes something like chatterer would be nice to add to the ambiance in stock. If fact, Chatterer is 1 of only 2 r4pt0r approved mods, along with enviormentalvisualenhancements.

Congrats on successfully resisting the siren song of other mods. I was almost sure that once you dabbled your toes in the forbidden waters you'd end up diving in.

I used b9 when I was new to ksp, back when .21 had just released, didnt like it, and the extra load time was inconvenient.

But Chatterer adds small things that help with the immersion into the gameplay. I really like the quiet breathing on EVA, the hatch opening and closing, and the "banter" between KSC and the mission craft(even though it is complete gibberish)
I would love the chatter to mirror the Kerbals' emotion... I think panicked chatter and all-out screaming during intense moments would be hilarious...
